intro: Sacosperma paniculatum, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pink spherical inflorescences that resemble snowballs. The plant has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
